abstract.para: This file provides documentation for file 96boct03.dat, a comma delimited file that contains bromide (Br) concentrations over time at two sites on the Inlet stream to Toolik Lake July 5, 1996.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Solute injection was made approximately 730 meters upstream of the stilling well. Samples were collected 300 and 750 meters downstream of the injection site

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATA RECEIVED: June 1997 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Karie Slavik DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: DATA:

para.literalLayout: The channel locations were instrumented with Orion bromide selective electrodes to monitor instream bromide concentrations and guide the collection of physical samples. Physical samples were collected at irregular time intervals weighted to cover the rising and falling limbs more intensively than other time periods. Upon return, the physical samples were analyised by HPLC on a Dionex AS4A Anion column with detection of 10 ug/L. The table below contains the solute injection parameters. Injection Start: 0 minutes Injection End: 210 minutes Stock Concentration: 477176 mg/L Injection Rate: 76 mL/min

Notes: (11) VARIABLE DESCRIPTIONS: Precis. Coded? Missing Variable Variable Description Units (Y/N) Values Site site of measurements y n D-Drip distance from Br dripper 5m n n Date date dd-mmm-yy n n Location Sampling location n n ET elapse time minutes n n mV millivolts mV n n Br Br concentration mg/L n n Comments Comments

Reference Citations: Kilpatrick,F.A. and Cobb,E.D. 1985. Measurement of discharge using tracers. Techniques of Water-Resource Investigations of the United States Geological Survey. Stream Solute Workshop 1990. Concepts and methods for assessing solute dynamics in stream ecosystems. J. N. Amer. Benthol. Soc., 9(2):95-119.
